trans-unit.source: Represents a declaration for an instance constructor of a type.
<xref:System.CodeDom.CodeConstructor> can be used to represent a declaration of an instance constructor for a type.
Use <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeTypeConstructor> to declare a static constructor for a type.
If the constructor calls a base class constructor, set the constructor arguments for the base class constructor in the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeConstructor.BaseConstructorArgs%2A> property.

If the constructor overloads another constuctor for the type, set the constructor arguments to pass to the overloaded type constructor in the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeConstructor.ChainedConstructorArgs%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeConstructor"></xref> class.
Gets the collection of base constructor arguments.
When the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeConstructor> overloads a base class constructor, this collection contains any arguments to pass to a base class constructor.
To call a base class constructor with no arguments, set a <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeSnippetExpression> containing an empty string ("") to this collection.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpressionCollection"></xref> that contains the base constructor arguments.
Gets the collection of chained constructor arguments.
When the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeConstructor> overloads another constructor of the same type, this collection contains any arguments to pass to the overloaded type constructor.
To call a constructor for the current type with no arguments, set a <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeSnippetExpression> containing an empty string ("") to this collection.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpressionCollection"></xref> that contains the chained constructor arguments.
